docs.snippet: After having arthroscopic surgery earlier this month, Giants quarterback Eli Manning said he will be “100 percent” when training camp begins in July....
docs.lead_paragraph: After having arthroscopic surgery earlier this month, Giants quarterback Eli Manning said he will be “100 percent” when training camp begins in July.
docs.abstract: New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning, recovering from arthroscopic surgery earlier in month, says he expects his ankle to be fully healed by the time training camp begins in July.

headline.main: Manning Says Ankle Will Heal for Camp
headline.print_headline: Manning Says Ankle Will Heal for Camp

docs.snippet: Five former Buffalo Bills cheerleaders sued the team over a pay system they say had them working hundreds of hours unpaid at games and at mandatory public appearances at which they were subjected to groping and sexual comments....
docs.lead_paragraph: Five former Buffalo Bills cheerleaders sued the team over a pay system they say had them working hundreds of hours unpaid at games and at mandatory public appearances at which they were subjected to groping and sexual comments.
docs.abstract: Five former Buffalo Bills cheerleaders sue team over pay system that they say has them wrongly classified as independent contractors, subjecting them to policies that violate New York State's minimum wage law.

docs.snippet: A football coach whose house was the scene of an under-age drinking party that preceded the rape of a girl by two high school football players in 2012 pleaded no contest to two charges on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A football coach whose house was the scene of an under-age drinking party that preceded the rape of a girl by two high school football players in 2012 pleaded no contest to two charges on Tuesday.
docs.abstract: Matt Belardine, volunteer football coach whose house was the scene of an under-age drinking party that preceded the rape of a girl by two Steubenville, Ohio, high school football players in 2012 pleads no contest to two charges.

headline.main: Ohio: Coach Accepts Plea Agreement in Inquiry Related to Rape Case
headline.print_headline: Ohio: Coach Accepts Plea Agreement in Inquiry Related to Rape Case

docs.snippet: Football players at Northwestern University on Friday are to become the first U.S. student athletes to vote on whether to join a union....
docs.lead_paragraph: Football players at Northwestern University on Friday are to become the first U.S. student athletes to vote on whether to join a union.

headline.main: Northwestern University Football Players to Vote on Friday on Union
headline.print_headline: Northwestern University Football Players to Vote on Friday on Union

docs.snippet: In 1982 an appeals court declared that as a football player, Fred W. Rensing should be considered an Indiana State employee, but the state’s Supreme Court reversed the ruling the next year....
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1982 an appeals court declared that as a football player, Fred W. Rensing should be considered an Indiana State employee, but the state’s Supreme Court reversed the ruling the next year.
docs.abstract: Unionization effort by football players at Northwestern University has revived interest in 1982 case in which football player Fred W Rensing was declared an Indiana State employee after suffering paralyzing injury in game; Indiana State Supreme Court reversed the ruling one year later, but case is still seen as a crucial precedent as players attempt to shift foundation of college athletics.

headline.main: Labor Case Filed by Injured Player in ’70s Has Echoes Today
headline.print_headline: Echoes Today of ’70s Case That Followed Player’s Injury

headline.print_headline: Penn St. Fans Plan New Statue of Joe Paterno

docs.snippet: European football is more divided today than it was during the Cold War because of the unequal distribution of wealth among its clubs, FIFA presidential candidate Jerome Champagne said....
docs.lead_paragraph: European football is more divided today than it was during the Cold War because of the unequal distribution of wealth among its clubs, FIFA presidential candidate Jerome Champagne said.

headline.main: Europe Split by Financial Iron Curtain, Says Champagne
